feed.title: MidwestWeekends - Travel in Minnesota, Wisconsin, Illinois, Iowa
feed.subtitle: ... because life's too short to stay home

entry.title: Lighthouses of Door County
entry.content: On this Lake Michigan peninsula, beacons are reminders of a more rugged past.

entry.title: A roof in the woods
entry.content: In state and county parks and forests around the Upper Midwest, visitors love their camper cabins.

entry.title: The people's park
entry.content: For generations, Itasca has been a sacred spot to Minnesotans.

entry.title: Lodgings in Minnesota state parks
entry.content: If you don't have a cabin of your own, Minnesota has one you can borrow.

entry.title: Circling Lake Superior
entry.content: A trip around the big lake provides everything a tourist's heart could desire.

entry.title: Dunes of Grand Marais
entry.content: At the end of the road, this quirky beach town is the eastern gateway to Pictured Rocks National Lakeshore.

entry.title: Lake Superior's greatest hits
entry.content: With this nine-day itinerary, take in the highlights of the magnificent Circle Tour.

entry.title: Graveyard of the Great Lakes
entry.content: For 200 years, a bottleneck on the east end of Lake Superior has claimed ships and lives.

entry.title: Digging the Keweenaw
entry.content: On Lake Superior, an isolated peninsula yields up all sorts of riches.

entry.title: Destination: Stockholm
entry.content: Once the promised land, this Lake Pepin village now is a favorite day trip.

entry.title: Grand sand
entry.content: Along Lake Michigan, the Sleeping Bear Dunes are a giant playground for families.

entry.title: America's freshwater Riviera
entry.content: On the gorgeous beaches of Wisconsin, Michigan, Indiana and Illinois, everyone can find a spot in the sun.
